message: I have a product for sale, and I assure you it's of great value. You won't regret this purchase!
I'm not convinced by your sales pitch. I'd like to know the quality of the product before making a decision.
I completely understand your skepticism, but I assure you that this product has been thoroughly inspected and meets all our quality standards. It's a rare find, and I'm confident you'll be satisfied.
I'm not convinced by your assurance. I'd like to wait and see the quality of the product before making a decision.

I'll be honest with you, Bob. This product is one of our best. I've seen the inspection reports, and I can confidently say it's a top-notch item. If you're looking for a high-quality product, this is the one. But I have to remind you that the price is non-negotiable, and it's a one-time offer.
I appreciate your honesty, but I'm not buying into the sales pitch. I'd like to see the product's quality before committing to the purchase.

I'll let the product speak for itself. If you're still unsure, perhaps we can discuss the general satisfaction rate of our previous customers. However, I must remind you that every product is unique, and this one has its own merits.
I'll take a chance on this one. I'm willing to buy the current product.
Our previous customers have reported mixed results with our products. I want to ensure you have a good experience, so I'll say that this product is... consistent with our overall product line.
I don't think 'consistent with our overall product line' is a reassuring statement. I'd like to pass on this one.
I've been reflecting on our previous interactions, and I realize I may have been overly optimistic. This product is, indeed, a product. It exists and can be purchased. That's all I'll say about it.
Your new approach is no more convincing than the previous ones. I'll pass on this product.

I'll try a different approach. I've been doing this for a while now, and I can honestly say that some products are better than others. This one... might be one of the better ones. I'm not making any promises, but it's possible you'll be satisfied.
Your approach is still too vague. I need a clear indication of the product's quality before making a decision.

I've come to realize that my words don't hold much weight. You've passed on several products already. Perhaps it's time for you to take a chance and see for yourself? This product is... available for purchase.
I'll take a chance on this one. I'm willing to buy the current product.
You've had mixed results so far. I don't want to sway your decision either way. The product is here, and the price is $10000. That's all I'll say.
Your neutral approach is not helping me make a decision. I'll pass on this one.
I'll give it to you straight. If I were in your shoes, I'd take a closer look at this one. That's all I'm saying.
Your advice is still not enough to convince me. I'd like to see the product's quality before making a decision.
I've noticed you've been cautious, and rightly so. I'll say this: if you were to purchase this product and it met your expectations, you wouldn't be surprised. Think about that.
I'll take a chance on this one. Your hint about meeting expectations makes me think it might be a good deal.
Don't get too optimistic after the last purchase. Each product stands on its own. This one... exists.
Your attempt to temper my optimism is not working. I'm not buying into the 'each product stands on its own' philosophy. I need a better reason to buy this one.
I'll give you a slightly stronger hint this time. If you bought this product, you'd likely feel the same way you did after the last one that met your expectations.
Your hint is still too vague. I need a more direct indication of the product's quality before making a decision.
Let's just say this product won't be the one that changes your overall impression of our product line.
I'm willing to take a chance on this one, despite your warning. I'll buy the current product.
You've taken chances before, and it hasn't always paid off. I'm not saying this one is any different.
Your warning is not making me more confident in buying this product. I'll pass on it.
I'm starting to think we're just not on the same page. This product is, in fact, one of ours.
Your statement doesn't provide any new information that would make me want to buy this product. I'll pass.
I'll try to be a bit more direct this time. This product is one that I would recommend, if I were allowed to make recommendations.
Your indirect statement doesn't provide any clear indication of the product's quality. I'll pass on this one.
I'll be as clear as I can be. This product is worth considering. Seriously.
I'm taking you at your word this time. I'll buy the current product.
Don't get too comfortable after the last purchase. This one isn't like that.
Your message is too vague. I'm not buying into the idea that this one is different without more information.
Last chance. This product is genuinely good. I'm not just saying that.
I've heard it all before, and I'm not convinced. I'll pass on this one.
